name: Slippbarinn - Old Harbor's First Craft Cocktail Bar
description: Slippbarinn pioneered craft cocktail culture in Reykjavík's Old Harbor when it opened at the stylish Icelandair Hotel Reykjavík Marina on Mýrargata 2, establishing the neighborhood's first serious cocktail bar and creating destination that attracts both hotel guests seeking sophisticated drinks without leaving the property and Reykjavík residents making special trips to experience ever-changing cocktail menus that showcase mixology creativity and Icelandic ingredients. The bar's concept explicitly embraces perpetual evolution—management describes Slippbarinn as a venue that "will never be fully formed but ever-changing," creating dynamic environment where diverse cocktail menus represent collections of creative experiments rather than static offerings that remain identical month after month, year after year. This philosophy attracts cocktail enthusiasts who seek novelty and innovation rather than predictable classics, though the bar maintains some signature drinks that have become house specialties. The "Harbor Mule" and "Icelandic Spritz" exemplify Slippbarinn's approach of blending traditional cocktail structures (the Moscow Mule's ginger beer and vodka combination, the Spritz's bubbly wine and bitter aperitif format) with contemporary twists and local Icelandic ingredients that might include wild herbs foraged from Icelandic hillsides, rhubarb grown in geothermal greenhouses, birch sap tapped from Iceland's limited tree populations, or artisanal Icelandic spirits distilled from local grains or potatoes. The bartenders' sincere approach and ideology behind each cocktail means drinks receive thoughtful construction rather than haphazard mixing—spirits, modifiers, sweeteners, acids, and garnishes are balanced to create harmonious flavor profiles while telling stories about Icelandic nature, cultural heritage, or seasonal changes. Operating hours accommodate both afternoon happy hour crowds and evening cocktail drinkers: bars stay open until 11:00 PM Sunday through Thursday and until midnight Friday and Saturday, while happy hour pricing runs 3:00-6:00 PM daily with a second "Very Late Happy Hour" Sunday-Thursday 10:00 PM-11:30 PM providing discounted drinks for late-night visitors who appreciate the cost savings on Reykjavík's expensive alcohol. Food service operates daily 12:00 PM to 9:30 PM, offering menu that complements cocktails with fresh, seasonal ingredients highlighting Iceland's culinary heritage—the food follows classic concepts with contemporary twists, paralleling the cocktail philosophy of respecting traditional preparations while incorporating modern techniques and local flavors. The Old Harbor location places Slippbarinn convenient to whale watching tour departures, maritime museums, waterfront walks, and the revitalized Grandi district that has become Reykjavík's trendiest neighborhood, filling with restaurants, galleries, and cultural venues that attract locals and visitors seeking alternatives to downtown's sometimes overwhelming tourist crowds. The Icelandair Hotel Marina's stylish design creates sophisticated atmosphere that appeals to travelers seeking upscale accommodations and cocktail experiences without the generic international hotel bar character—Slippbarinn feels distinctly Icelandic while maintaining professional service and drink quality that international visitors expect. The combination of innovative cocktails, happy hour value, waterfront location, hotel convenience, and ever-changing menus that reward repeat visits makes Slippbarinn essential stop for serious cocktail enthusiasts and casual drinkers alike.
address: Mýrargata 2, 101 Reykjavík (Icelandair Hotel Reykjavík Marina, Old Harbor)
